text: Grevillea intricata is a shrub which is endemic to the south-west of Western Australia. It grows up to 3 metres in height and produces flowers between May and October (late autumn to mid spring) in its native range. The species was first formally described by botanist Carl Meissner, in a paper published in Hooker's Journal of Botany and Kew Garden Miscellany in 1855. ==References== * * * intricata Category:Eudicots of Western Australia Category:Proteales of Australia Category:Taxa named by Carl Meissner
title: Grevillea intricata
